bill_title: increase the per diem paid to jurors.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the per diem paid to jurors. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-13-46 be amended to read as follows: 16-13-46. Each juror for each day's attendance upon the circuit court or the magistrate court shall receive forty fifty dollars, and mileage at such rate as may be established pursuant to § 3-9-1 for each mile actually and necessarily traveled, to be paid by the county. However , any juror called but not impaneled shall receive an appearance fee of ten dollars and, in addition, mileage at such rate as may be established pursuant to § 3-9-1 for each mile actually and necessarily traveled. Such juror's fees, except as provided in § 16-13-47, shall be paid by the county treasurer upon the presentation of warrants which . The warrants shall be issued by the county auditor forthwith upon filing of each juror's certificate of attendance , which . Each certificate shall bear the endorsement or certificate of the clerk of the court in which such fees accrued to the effect that said the certificate is accurate as to the time expended and the amount of fees claimed. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the per diem paid to jurors. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-13-46 be amended to read as follows: 16-13-46. Each juror for each day's attendance upon the circuit court or the magistrate court shall receive a minimum of forty dollars, and mileage at such rate as may be established pursuant to § 3-9-1 for each mile actually and necessarily traveled, to be paid by the county. However , any juror called but not impaneled shall receive an appearance fee of ten dollars and, in addition, mileage at such rate as may be established pursuant to § 3-9-1 for each mile actually and necessarily traveled. Such juror's fees, except as provided in § 16-13-47, shall be paid by the county treasurer upon the presentation of warrants which . The warrants shall be issued by the county auditor forthwith upon filing of each juror's certificate of attendance , which . Each certificate shall bear the endorsement or certificate of the clerk of the court in which such fees accrued to the effect that said the certificate is accurate as to the time expended and the amount of fees claimed. BILL HISTORY 1/21/99 First read in House and referred to Judiciary. H.J. 110 1/27/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/27/99 Judiciary Do Pass, Passed, AYES 11, NAYS 0. H.J. 206 1/28/99 Motion to Amend, Passed, AYES 58, NAYS 11. H.J. 253 1/28/99 House of Representatives Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 61, NAYS 8. H.J. 254

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the per diem paid to jurors. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-13-46 be amended to read as follows: 16-13-46. Each juror for each day's attendance upon the circuit court or the magistrate court shall receive forty fifty dollars, and mileage at such rate as may be established pursuant to § 3-9-1 for each mile actually and necessarily traveled, to be paid by the county. However , any juror called but not impaneled shall receive an appearance fee of ten dollars and, in addition, mileage at such rate as may be established pursuant to § 3-9-1 for each mile actually and necessarily traveled. Such juror's fees, except as provided in § 16-13-47, shall be paid by the county treasurer upon the presentation of warrants which . The warrants shall be issued by the county auditor forthwith upon filing of each juror's certificate of attendance , which . Each certificate shall bear the endorsement or certificate of the clerk of the court in which such fees accrued to the effect that said the certificate is accurate as to the time expended and the amount of fees claimed.
